txt.en: 'Still I linger,\none foe remains.'
'Please return the ring as well....'
Shield-brother
Defeated wights ([placeholder]/[placeholder])

'Against many did we fight,
for a treasure, which we stole.
Rose they from the ground
at his call
his cackle, cough and cry.
Fighting at the edge of stone
in a hollow where we lay the bones.'
You hear: 'This is not the place. Go south.'
You hear: 'This is not the place. Go south-west.'
Dead rise near a south facing wall among burial mounds of Men.\n\nThe shade, in its cryptic way, asked you for assistance in ridding the place where he died of the fell barrow-wights.
You hear: 'This is not the place. Go south-west'
The Wandering Shade is in the northern Barrow-downs.\n\nYou found wights, risen from their graves, and defeated them at the pass leading to the southern Barrow-downs.
You hear: 'This is not the place. Go north-west.'

The shade's alley lies near Bree's South-gate.\n\nYou should take the ring back to the shade in Bree and tell him of your encounter with the wight-slave and of the Bone Man. The shade will not likely appear in his alley except at night.
You hear: 'This is not the place. Go west.'

The shade's alley lies near Bree's South-gate.\n\nYou should take the ring back to the shade in Bree and tell him of your encounter with the wight-slave and of the Bone Man. The shade will not likely appear in his alley except at night.
You hear: 'This is not the place. Go north'
You hear: 'This is not the place. Go north-west.'
You hear: 'This is not the place. Go north.'
Defeat wights near the place where the brothers placed the Cardolan treasure ([placeholder]/[placeholder])
Talk to the Wandering Shade in the northern Barrow-downs
Return the ring to the shade in Bree.
Return the ring to the shade in Bree.
You hear: 'This is not the place. Go south-west.'
You hear: 'This is not the place. Go north.'
Wight-slave defeated
A shade found wandering in the Barrow-downs -- meaning no ill, it seems -- felt the pull of its brother and struggles to appease whatever force has returned to awaken them.
The heavy door refuses to move
You found a ring

'Sundered and shattered,
metal and bone,
life bled onto the ground.

'In shade of stone,
a south facing wall
wherein the earth
slept once the dead.

'On cold hallowed ground
where dead lay asleep
woke they to greet
our treasure claimed.

'There, by our honoured,
sleeping and gone,
my brother bid me farewell.

'Now, the dead rise, 
stirring the earth
now cursed from where
I fell.

'Our curse recalled;
we shall walk
until the dead
are quelled.'
